ygData.msgSnippet: Jeff, You are creating lots of Cantera objects in loops that execute many times.  This is a problem.  For functions like IdealGasMix and importPhase, you

From: David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...>
Subject: Re: [cantera] Cantera equilibrate RAM problems
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=44728387; y=xJsOmal7DqDV9_vTsh4BseaYVxfHJt5r_TY2GkOVBFjb
X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

Jeff,

You are creating lots of Cantera objects in loops that execute many  
times.  This is a problem.  For functions like IdealGasMix and  
importPhase, you should only need to call them once for problems  
involving a single phase (for example, a gas).  Reactors present a few  
complications due to the syntax in which a reactor is created and  
initialized in one statement. (I never thought of users creating  
reactor networks inside loops - I assumed a reactor network would be  
created once, the simulation run, and the results output.)  If you can  
restructure your calculation in a way that objects are not created in  
loops, you'll have better results in MATLAB. There may be some other  
memory issues with the multiphase equilibrium solver - I'm still  
looking into that.

Dave


On Jul 8, 2005, at 3:13 PM, jemiller@... wrote:

> Dr Goodwin,
> Here are the m-files that cause the problem, along with the cti file  
> containing

> reactor1_equilibrium_HP.m
> is my original file.  The second one is the one that uses clear all and
> cleanup, but still crashes.  Thank you very much for taking the time  
> to help me
> with my problem.
> Jeff Miller
